events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the details of the collision and the involved vehicle types.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the claim and begin coordinating the next steps with all parties involved.
Confirmation of the claim receipt was sent to the customer, informing them about the claims process and expected timelines.
A request for additional documentation including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates was sent to the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents promptly, including the police report and multiple photos showing the extent of the vehicle damage.
An investigation into the accident circumstances and liability was initiated by the claims adjustment team.
The investigation concluded determining that the claimant was not at fault, supported by the police report and witness testimonies.
A settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repair costs and a rental car for the claimant during the repair period.
The claimant responded positively expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling and fair settlement offer.
The claim was approved officially to move forward with issuing payment based on the agreed settlement amount.
Payment was issued to the claimant's repair shop and rental company to cover all expenses as per the settlement agreement.
The claim was formally closed following confirmation that all repairs were completed satisfactorily and all payments processed.
All claim documentation and correspondence were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
